lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq Awpw Koie gurdwsu hoie bwl buiD suiD n krq moh dRoh kI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Aapaa Khoi Gurdaasu Hoi , Baal Budhi Sudhi N Karat Moh Droh Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One becomes true disciple only by getting the divine word of Guru absorbed in the mind and becoming a humble slave of the Guru. For virtually a possessor of the child-like wisdom, he is free of deceit and infatuations.

lines.transliteration_english: Sravan Ousatati Nindaa Sam Tul Surati Liva , Lochan Dhiaan Liv Kanchan Au Loh Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Since his consciousness is engrossed in the name of the Lord; he is least affected by praise or rejection.

lines.gurmukhi: nwskw sugMD ibrgMD smsir qw kY ijhbw smwin ibK AMmiRq n boh kI
lines.transliteration_english: Naasakaa Sougandh Biragandh Samasari Taa Kai , Jihabaa Samaani Bikh Anmrit N Boh Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Fragrance and foul smell, poison or elixir are the same for him, because his (devotee's) conscious is absorbed in Him.

lines.gurmukhi: kr cr krm Akrm ApQ pQ ikriq ibriq sm aukiq n dRoh kI ]107]
lines.transliteration_english: Kar Char Karam Akaram Apad Pada , Kirati Birati Sam Oukati N Droh Kee ?107?

Shabad OS B.translation: He remains stable and uniform even if he uses his hands in good or indifferent deeds; or treads path not worthy of appreciation. Such a devotee never harbours any feeling of deceit, falsehood or ill deeds. (107)
